page.title: 05LOCAL FOOTPATHS
page.content: We carried out a survey of the footpaths in our villages to see if they were all clear for the walkers.We used an Ordnance Survey map to see where the footpaths should be and then went out to find them.The path along the bank of the River Arun was really good with nice short grass to walk on.We watched the swans floating on the tide and saw a heron at the water side.We went all the way to the railway bridge.By the marina we looked for signs of the old canal but couldn't see much except the lock-keeper's cottage.The tow-path is still marked by a footpath and you can walk all the way to Chichester.We couldn't find the path from the river to the Caravan Park because the farmer had sown the field with wheat but there there was a signpost to show where the path should be.
